title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #535: GCD-Free r-Subsets**

Estimate f_r(N): max size of A ⊆ {1,...,N} with no r elements having equal pairwise gcds.

**Status: OPEN**
- Upper: N^{1/2+o(1)} (Abbott-Hanson)
- Lower: N^{c/log log N} (Erdős)
- Conjectured: lower bound is tight
mathContext: Connects number theory to extremal combinatorics. Intimately related to the Sunflower Conjecture.

title: HasNoRGCDSubset
content:
**HasNoRGCDSubset(A, r):**

No r elements of A have the same pairwise gcd.

Formally: no S ⊆ A with |S| = r and gcd(a,b) = d for all distinct a,b ∈ S.

title: f_r(N)
content:
**f(r, N):**

Maximum size of A ⊆ {1,...,N} satisfying HasNoRGCDSubset.

The main object of study in this problem.

title: Erdős (1964) Upper Bound
Abbott-Hanson (1970)
content:
**abbott_hanson_upper_bound:**

f_r(N) ≤ N^{1/2+o(1)}

Improved exponent from 3/4 to 1/2. This is the best known upper bound!

Published in Bull. London Math. Soc. (1970).

title: Exponent Improvement
content:
**exponent_improvement:**

3/4 > 1/2

Abbott-Hanson's bound is strictly better than Erdős's original.

title: Erdős Lower Bound
content:
**erdos_lower_bound:**

f_3(N) > N^{c/log log N}

This is quasi-polynomial: grows slower than N^ε for any ε > 0, but faster than polylog.

Erdős conjectured this is also an upper bound.

title: The Gap
content:
**current_gap:**

Upper: N^{1/2} (polynomial)
Lower: N^{c/log log N} (quasi-polynomial)

The gap is enormous - polynomial vs quasi-polynomial!

title: Erdős's Conjecture
content:
**ErdosConjecture:**

f_r(N) ≤ N^{c/log log N} for some constant c.

The lower bound should be tight. This would close the gap dramatically!

title: Sunflower Connection
content:
**Connection to Sunflower Problem:**

Erdős's conjecture would follow from a stronger Sunflower Lemma.

The original Erdős-Rado sunflower bound is c_r^k · k!.
A bound of c_r^k (removing k!) would suffice.

See Problem #20 (Sunflower Conjecture).

title: Proof Techniques
content:
**Methods used:**

1. **Counting** - Erdős's approach to upper bounds
2. **Graph theory** - Abbott-Hanson's Turán-type argument
3. **Multiplicative constructions** - For lower bounds

The mismatch between multiplicative GCD and additive counting makes the problem hard.

title: Summary
content:
**Erdős Problem #535: OPEN**

**Problem:** Estimate f_r(N)

**Known:**
- Upper: N^{1/2+o(1)} (Abbott-Hanson)
- Lower: N^{c/log log N} (Erdős)

**Conjecture:** f_r(N) ≤ N^{c/log log N}

**Connection:** Would follow from strong sunflower conjecture.
